titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

body.p: I returned to town by the morning train, arriving just in time for the Chapter meeting. Here Barnett advanced his wish for the large room, to be added to his house at the cost of the Chapter. I opposed and finally the project was defeated. Our new Canon does not impress me favourably. We also voted a general approval of the plan for restoring the Refectory of the Infirmary with the view of making it into a Common Hall.
Presented by my Father in Law.

list.item: Alice Gardner's Letter to a Godchild.
Burkitt's The Gospel Hist. & its transmission.
